data.title: LeBron James
data.meta_description: The Official Website of LeBron James
data.text:
LRMR Ventures is the home office of LeBron and Maverick that manages their expanding portfolio of projects, partnerships, investments, and other business ventures. Established in 2006, LRMR facilitates all facets of business from branding, marketing and communications to human resources, finance, and other backend services for our internal companies.

Founded in 2004, the LeBron James Family Foundation commits its time, resources, and efforts to the kids and families in Akron who need it most. Focusing on education as the fundamental key to generational change, the Foundation serves more than 1,400 at-risk students and their families with interventions, incentives, and complete wraparound supports to help them create a better future. In 2018, all of the Foundation’s programming culminated in the opening of the I PROMISE School, a groundbreaking Akron Public School rooted in the Foundation’s “We Are Family” philosophy that is creating a model for urban, public education.

A kid from Akron has inspired kids and people from around the world with his relentless commitment to pushing for more, to striving for greatness. Central to that pursuit is his commitment to the youth coming after him in his hometown of Akron and across the globe – made visible by the I PROMISE bands they wear on the wrist daily. In the LeBron James Store, you can be a part of that commitment to being best with various versions of the bands LeBron wears each and every day as a reminder of this shared promise to lift each other up.

Founded by LeBron and Maverick in 2008, SpringHill Entertainment develops creative content across a variety of platforms including digital, documentary and feature films, and scripted and unscripted TV. Named after the public housing complex where James grew up in Akron, Ohio, SpringHill Entertainment prides itself on incubating, developing, and producing work that speaks to a cross-cultural audience.

UNINTERRUPTED is the athlete empowerment brand created by LeBron and Maverick in 2015 to give athletes around the world a platform to tell their stories. It has evolved into so much more, spearheading the “More Than” movement that inspires and encourages all people to reach beyond their occupation. The UNINTERRUPTED brand includes a multi-platform digital sports network, original and branded content and exclusive merchandise.m.

2008 - 2010

One and Done

LeBron's Bike-A-Thon was one of many "one-and-done" events the Foundation sponsored for several years to creative positive experiences for families in Akron. But LeBron always knew he could do more. And so he went to work...

2015

I PROMISE Scholarship

The University of Akron

In 2015, LeBron takes it a step further. He partnered with The University of Akron to guarantee all of his eligible I PROMISE students free, four year college scholarships. The announcement immediately changes the dreams and long-term plans of families across Akron.

2018 - 2019

Urban Public Education

Now the kid from Akron is rolling all of his efforts in to the I PROMISE School in order to change the lives of kids and families across Akron and create a model of urban public education for the rest of the world to follow.

2020

Free Tuition, Room, & Board

Kent State University

Taking their shared commitment to LeBron’s kids to a new level, Kent State University offered the life-changing opportunity of free tuition to LeBron’s Akron I PROMISE Network students. Now the I PROMISE students have a world of opportunity and choices for their next educational step.

AT&T and LeBron have teamed up for a long-term, multi-faceted partnership rooted in the mutual mission to use technology, entertainment and innovation towards social advancement, including at the Foundation’s I PROMISE Village serving families in immediate need.

A by-chance stop into a RIMOWA store has evolved into a partnership where LeBron is not only a fan of the internationally-acclaimed brand, but a face of the brand as well.

When it comes to his body and his regimen, LeBron uses only the best to remain at the top of his game. That’s why he founded sports nutrition company Ladder, along with Arnold Schwarzenegger and his trainer, Mike Mancias, to create safe, certified sports nutrition products he could trust.

LeBron knows taking care of your mind is just as important as taking care of your body. Through his partnership with Calm, he is empowering people around the world to recognize and value the important of mental fitness, while providing the tools needed to achieve it. He is also extending those resources to the social emotional supports provided at the I PROMISE School and youth organizations across the country.

James Gang

In everything LeBron does and everywhere he goes in the world, family always comes first. Inscribed on every insole of every sneaker of every game are the names of Savannah, Bronny, Bryce, and Zhuri. The James Gang.

Graduate Together

With a worldwide pandemic prompting the cancellation of graduation ceremonies for so many scholars, LeBron and the LeBron James Family Foundation helped host a once-in-a-lifetime celebration for the Class of 2020 featuring some of the nation’s most prominent leaders, entertainers, and educators that was broadcast across all major U.S. networks and streaming platforms.

1999 - 2003

St. Vincent-St. Mary High School

LeBron’s meteoric rise started early in his tenure at St. Vincent – St. Mary high school in Akron, OH, where he and the famed “Fab Five” led the school to three state titles in their historic run. Along the way, he earned accolades including Mr. Ohio Basketball (2001-2003), Mr. Basketball (2002-2003), Gatorade Player of the Year (2002) and became a McDonald’s All American MVP in 2003.

June 26, 2003

NBA Draft

In the 2003 NBA Draft, LeBron was selected number one overall to his hometown team, the Cleveland Cavaliers. In his first season, he became the franchise’s first player – and the youngest player ever – to win the NBA Rookie of the Year Award.

2003 - 2010

Cleveland Cavaliers

LeBron spent his first seven seasons in the NBA with the Cleveland Cavaliers. A leader on and off the floor, LeBron helped lead the Cavs to three postseason appearances. In the 2007-2008 season, he won the NBA scoring title averaging 30 points per game.

2010 - 2014

Miami Heat

After exercising his free agency for the first time in his career, James joined the Miami Heat in the 2010-11 season. The team won back-to-back championships in 2012 and 2013 with LeBron earning Finals MVP awards in each campaign.

2016

NBA History

After making it to the Finals but falling short in his first season back, in year two, LeBron led the Cavaliers back from a 3-1 deficit to win the franchise’s first championship and the city’s first title in more than 50 years. He was again voted Finals MVP. He would bring the Cavaliers back to the finals the following two seasons, capping an historic run of eight-straight finals appearances.

2018 - 2020

Los Angeles Lakers

In 2018, LeBron joined the Los Angeles Lakers, taking the opportunity to help return the historic franchise to its former glory. Following in the footsteps of the game’s largest legends, LeBron is now in his second season in purple and gold.

2004, 2008, 2012

Olympics

LeBron has proudly represented USA in the Olympics three times, helping Team USA earn medals in each campaign. In the 2004 Olympics, he helped the team win a bronze medal in Athens. In the 2008 Beijing Olympics, he helped the historic USA Dream Team win gold. In 2012 he helped team USA repeat with back-to-back golds in the London Olympics.
